title: Multimedia Educational Material Development Process Based on Practitioner Interviews

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and foundational understanding of digital content creation tools
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical competency in developing multimedia materials within smartphone-centric limited environments

learning_goals: They can explain key activities in each stage of the multimedia production process (planning, design, development, evaluation) with 80% accuracy.
They can present three or more core responsibilities for key roles (planner, designer, developer) required in developing science education multimedia.
They can apply multimedia production techniques usable in mobile environments (e.g., storyboard creation, video editing) to develop one science-themed educational resource.
They can apply success factors derived from practitioner interviews (e.g., content consistency, user feedback incorporation) to project development.

resources: Free Mobile Editing Tools for Smartphones (e.g., CapCut, Canva)
Multimedia Sample Materials for Science Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
